short_summary: Provide and install gates and fencing to divide yard in MHY building.
description: Supply and install gates and fencing to divide yard in MHY building at Millhaven Institution in Bath, Ontario. The scope of work includes providing and installing approximately 26m of 3600mm high chain-link fence with posts and steel Y arms with Barbed Tape Concertina (BTC) installed on both sides. The new fence must be secured to existing fence at intersections in conformance with Technical Criteria Document (TCD) and be secured to bottom rail. Delivery period: 8 weeks.

full_summary:
**Government Tender Notice**
==========================

**Project Title**: Y Unit Mini Yard Fence, Millhaven Institution

**Reference Number**: PW-22-01007054

**Solicitation Number**: 21401-22/23-4192561

**Publication Date**: September 15, 2022

**Tender Closing Date**: December 9, 2022, 1:00 PM EST

**Amendment Date**: November 25, 2022

**Contract Type**: Request for Proposal

**Government Agency**: Correctional Service of Canada (CSC)

The CSC Millhaven Institution, Ontario Region, invites all interested suppliers to submit a bid for the supply and installation of gates and fencing to divide a yard in the MHY building within the institution's maximum-security area. The project aims to install approximately 26m of 3600mm high chain-link fence with posts and steel Y arms, along with Barbed Tape Concertina installed on both sides, in accordance with the Technical Criteria Document.

**Important Details**

* The project is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
* All interested suppliers may submit a bid.
* The procurement strategy is Lowest Priced Compliant Bid.
* The project is not subject to Indigenous Business Procurement Strategy or Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement.
* Security requirements are not applicable to this project.

**Tender Documents**
----------------

The detailed statement of work and evaluation criteria are available for download from Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders. Suppliers can obtain the documents in either English or French.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For queries and questions, please contact:

Kelly, Mark
Mark.Kelly@csc-scc.gc.ca
613-545-8274

**Note to Bidders**
------------------

* Suppliers must submit their bids in accordance with the requirements outlined in the tender documents.
* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.

**Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) Seminars**
---------------------------------------------

* Overview of the federal government contracting process
* Searching for opportunities on the Buy and Sell - Tenders website
* Bidding on opportunities
